lines.text: I'm sorry Bertie, but I've decided that I can't marry you.
Oh, but why? Uh, why the sudden change? I mean to say, dash it.
You don't come up to specifications.
Specifications? Uuh, what am I, a horse or a silly ass?
Oh, well I wouldn't say that you were silly.
But my dear, you know, you can't judge a husband in a bathing suit.
No, but you can get a rough idea.
Ooh.
The more I see of men, the more I love my dog.
[Questioning Reginald Irving]
Have you ever had anything to do with women?
Oh, I used to sell vacuum cleaners.
No no, I mean, have you ever had a love affair with a woman?
Oh, gosh no.
Well, you're going to have.
Oh, I can't. I don't get paid until Saturday.
Well, I should think she'd be able to take one look at you and realize that if you were left alone with a woman... why...
We'd both be safe.
[pause]
I-I was in a house one time, aaall alone with the most beautiful French maid... and she tried to kiss me. She was baking a pie...
And what did you do?
...I ate the pie.
Now, when you first get to your room, order some... uh, champagne and broiled lobster.
Champ... Ch... Can't you make it beer?
Beer? Certainly not. Champagne!
[pause]
C, H, A, M, P, A, uh... oh, well, make it wine. W, I, N, E.
Oh well, what do I call her?
Oh, call her... kid, sweetheart, baby...
Kid, sweetheart, baby.
Uh huh. And then when you're helping her to take off her...
Take off her what?
Wrap!
R, A, P.
No, WRAP! *W*, R, A, P.
Wap?
Wap?... Well, make it coat.
K, O, T, E.
You're just as safe with me as you would be in jail.
You're dead and you won't lay down.
You have all the passion of an infuriated clam.
